item.title: Week 1: Getting Started
item.description: Introduction to the Course and Tools Welcome to the course! Before we start any data science we will get to know each other, the tools we will use, and the policies of the course. If you have any questions about Week 1 materials please post them on Slack (you will soon see what Slack is). The following is the basic set-up for all tasks required each week. Week 1 does include a lot of tasks - we will need to sign up and install our tools - but an average week will include about 5 tasks.

item.title: Week 2: Visualizing Data
item.description: Grammar of Graphics & ggplot This week we will be discussing what qualities makes a graphic legible and how we can use R to implement readability using the Grammar of Graphics. | Tasks | Notes | Links | Due | | â€”â€”â€“ | â€”â€”â€”â€”- | â€”â€” | â€”- | -Add links to The Pudding and make it a reading response (https://pudding.cool/) - add ggplot flipbook (https://evamaerey.github.io/ggplot_flipbook/ggplot_flipbook_xaringan.html#1) note: requires computer (not smart device friendly) - top 10 do and donâ€™t for charts (https://guides.

item.title: Week 3: Cleaning Data
item.description: Tidy Data, Data Wrangling & Joins Tasks Notes Links Due

MATH 4180 - Industrial Problem Solving University of Minnesota Duluth Spring 2021 This course introduces the full data cycle. Topics include data collection and retrieval, data cleaning, exploratory analysis and visualization, introduction to statistical modeling and inference, and communicating findings. Applications include real data from wide-range of fields following reproducible practices. Instructor Dr. Tracy Bibelnieks (she/her/hers) tbibelni@d.umn.edu Office Hours TBD Instructor Kim Mandery (she/her/hers) mande143@d.umn.edu Office Hours MWF 12-1:30pm CST
